data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the beginning, face forward. All left and right directions are left. As you follow the directions backward, take a step right or left. You always return to the beginning. So, the answer is no.

Turn around rewinds the instruction. Turn around rewinds the instruction. So, the answer is Yes.

You change position as you walk. You are not necessarily walking in a straight line. With the instructions you only take 6 steps return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

There is 0 step in one direction and 1 step in the other. So, the answer is No.

For the directions to turn left and right, you travel to turn right and turn around. The instructions in the video show one direction is the same as the one in the video. So, the answer is No.

This is like always facing forward. If you turn off the clock, it is a little less efficient. So, the answer is yes.

Take three steps to come to the beginning. Take 9 steps in total and you will be turned around. If you return to the starting point with 3 steps, you will take 7 steps to come to the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

One cannot take 2 steps left and 6 steps backward at the same time. So, the answer is No.

Since you are always facing forward, the instructions will only instruct you to take 3 steps left and you will never have to take more than 3 steps left. Similarly, taking 4 steps right is in the directions of always being in forward motion. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Take 4 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 6 steps left. Take 14 steps left. Bring back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The start of an alternate route is always right when facing forward. The first three steps are still right. The last two steps are backwards. So, the answer is no.

You don’ t go round. If you go around once you return to the starting point. If you’ re the same direction as the starting point it can’ t be reversed. You need four steps to get back to the starting point, and four steps aren’t enough. So, the answer is No.

This has a total step of 7. This has a total back of 9. If you get to the starting point, take 3 steps, 1 step, 7 steps, 1 step, 7 steps. This has a total back of 9. This has a total step of 7. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

Assigning the correct order for the steps is very important. If you see 7 steps left, you’ll make seven backwards. Similarly, you’ll see 7 steps right, which is seven backwards. If you see 8 steps backward, you’ll make 8 steps backward. Thus, the answer is yes.

Backwards is the opposite of forward. Forwards is the opposite of backward. So, the answer is No.
